Title: Double-page Illustrated Frontispiece Depicting a Court Scene
Medium: ink and pigments on brown laid paper
Description: This is the right side of a double-page illustrated frontispiece from Walters manuscript W.628 showing a pavilion reception between a princely figure, a female companion, and attendants. The inscription running along the top is a Persian couplet. There has been some damage and repainting to this illustration.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Iran; Sufism; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [Ex libris on upper board inside]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hafiz (Persian, flourished 8th century AH/AD 14th century)
